    • Direct Download from GEO with Annotation for Skin Cell scRNA-seq

Read Counts Data

ReadAnnotateCountsSCE.Rd

Read counts data from file and annotate the generated Single Cell Experiment Object. Right now this function assumes: - mouse cells - only spike ins are ERCC - row and column names are provided in the data - the row names are gene symbols In the case of GEO data, it takes a GSE accession code and assumes that the supp files contain all the expression data

ReadAnnotateCountsSCE(filepath = NULL, inf_exp_rate = 0,
  inf_gene_count = 0, inf_cell_count = 0, series_accession,
  metad_title = "characteristics_ch1", cell_id = "title",
  pheno_filter = NULL, plot_title = NULL, GEOfilecache = getwd(),
  annotation_db, feature_annotation_key, remove_spike_ERCC = FALSE,
  pre_clust = FALSE, rescale = TRUE, var_gene_method = "mean_var",
  ...)

Arguments

filepath

the full or relative (to the workspace) path of the data file
inf_exp_rate

the minimum mean expression rate of retained genes
inf_gene_count

retain a gene if more than this number of cells express it
inf_cell_count

retain a cell if more than this number of genes are expressed in it
series_accession

the series accession code, eg "GSE67602"
metad_title

the series accession code, eg "GSE67602"
cell_id

the series accession code, eg "GSE67602"
pheno_filter

a vector of strings to partially match cell metadata
plot_title

path of the saved mean/variance plot, default NULL, if NULL the plot will be printed instead
GEOfilecache

location for caching series supplemental files, default is current directory
annotation_db

annotation package for the data, eg "org.Mm.eg.db"
feature_annotation_key

the key for annotation.db lookups, eg "SYMBOL"
remove_spike_ERCC

remove ERCC spike ins after they are used for normalization
pre_clust

whether or not to precluster the cells before getting size factors
rescale

whether to compute size factors and rescale counts
var_gene_method

how to select variable genes, eg 'mean_var', 'pca'. mean_var selects the genes whose variance is highest after removing the fitted spike-in-based technical variance. pca finds the genes with the max rotation coefficients
...

arguments to called functions

Value

a list containing:

c(seur, sce)

a seurat or sce object

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
